posts.name: Michael Lee
posts.cooked:
I’m new to sysid this year. I have successfully done it with an Arm. But now I want to SysID a chassis with the target being an april tag. With this setup:

Rev Swerve Max

Limelight camera using yaw as the target measurement.

Photon Vision Installed on it

I tried creating a sysid routine, capture logs, and hack the Voltage as Distance instead. I figured it wouldn’t work and I get this error

Code is located here: https://github.com/ FRC -7272-Envirobots/2024-Crescendo-Advanced/blob/main/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/DriveSubsystem.java#L277

I know that field relative drive is the hot thing right now. But I wanted to first write commands that orient the robot to the correct april tag yaw and area for shooting. Baby steps, then do the fancier stuff. Or am I totally off base here?

I appreciate any help that you provide. Excited for regionals tomorrow.

posts.name: Eli Barnett
posts.cooked: What exactly are you trying to do?

First write commands that orient the robot to the correct april tag yaw and area for shooting.I have a command already written but the PID values are way off. https://github.com/ FRC -7272-Envirobots/2024-Crescendo-Advanced/blob/main/src/main/java/frc/robot/commands/AprilTagPID.java

posts.name: Robertson Robotics
posts.cooked:
Working with distance instead of velocity shouldn’t be too difficult, in fact it sounds derivative .

Are you sure your repository is publicly available?

posts.name: Michael Lee
posts.cooked: Oops sorry. I didn’t realize it was private. Its public now.

posts.name: Eli Barnett
posts.cooked:
SysId probably won’t be able to fit this scenario directly - it doesn’t closely match any of the available model types (not directly, at any rate) and the data source (vision) is quite noisy.

You’re better off tuning these gains manually, though i’m unsure if a single set of gains will work well in all cases with this control strategy.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!

posts.cooked: Yeah I figured that was the case and wasn’t missing anything. Thank you!
